sentence.text: Patient 8 had a lower eyelid coloboma and sparse lower eyelashes (Fig. 1e), and was diagnosed with a blocked nasolacrimal duct.
He had micrognathia, choanal stenosis and a tracheoesophageal fistula, and required a tracheostoma for airway management.
The ears were small and dysplastic.
On the right hand, he had a bifid thumb (Fig. 2n).
He suffered from a coarctation of the aorta.
